comment.text: Best BBQ in town!!!! Fall off the bone and tasty. The service is always great as well!

Fat Matt's is   the love that is placed in every dish that is very warm from your head to your toe as you are fulfilled from every bite. The portions are great. The food comes out quick and the lady at the register is very friendly.

Oh. My. Goodness.

I visited Fat Matt's on my boyfriend's recommendation ("They're the best ribs I've had in my life probably"), and I'm happy to report that it lived up to the hype.

My party of three arrived at about 7:15PM on a Thursday night, and was able to get a table indoors pretty easily. We ordered a full slab of ribs to share between the three of us plus an assortment of sides (mac n cheese, coleslaw, potato salad, collard greens, and baked beans). The sides were nothing shabby, but they paled beside the glory of the ribs. I would describe myself as a rib aficionado (as a child, it was my favorite meal and I would eat the bone clean). They're fall-off-the-bone tender, expertly flavored, and had plenty of meat on em. If I wasn't so stuffed, I probably could have finished a half-rack by myself.

Along with all the meat, we grabbed a pitcher of Sweetwater 420 on draft. The waitresses were a little skeptical that my young-looking coworker and I were over 21, but sent us on our way after some good-natured ribbing.

It's no gourmet interior, but it's exactly what you'd expect/want from somewhere called "Fat Matt's". At about 8PM, the band set up to play for the night and really brought the party with some bluesy music. We were sitting right next to the stage so got blasted by the sound, but it was still great.
The food is very good the line might be a little long at lunch or on the weekend but it is worth the wait

This place was great!! From the service to the food! My only issue - the ribs weren't as "meaty" as I expected and I got several end pieces :(

But the flavor & sauce was really amazing! Mac& cheese was good as well as the baked beans!! 

Highly recommend
Read about this place on a Reddit thread and it did not disappoint. Amazingly tender ribs and awesome sides. Next time I'm in Atlanta I will definitely be coming back!

Alright. I don't crave BBQ often but a friend really wanted southern BBQ as our first meal after landing in ATL. Fat Matt's was an excellent choice and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a simple, authentic, and delicious BBQ experience in Atlanta. 

I had the 1/2 bird (chicken) w/ potato salad & mac and cheese. I devoured most of my meal and took the rest of the chicken to-go. I'd say that my experience with good quality BBQ is pretty limited, but this one really hit the spot. The BBQ flavor was perfect and the sides were such a good complement to the chicken. I ate the leftover chicken the next day and still enjoyed it.

The space is pretty small and this place is very casual. We came for a late lunch so the place was empty. The servers were kind and I felt very welcomed. If I'm ever back in the area, I'd love to come back here.
Loved the blues vibe. Food was delicious and came out quick. I would definitely recommend to everyone.

Atlanta's rib scene is on point. After going to Fox Bros, I came to Fat Matt's two days later. Fox Bros had more of a dry rub, while Fat Matt was wet. 

I came here on a recommendation from one of my friends who lived in Atlanta for 5 years. It was quite out of the way so I didn't think I was going to be able to make it. But then my Uber driver HIGHLY recommended this place... so I had to go. 

These ribs are fantastic. Full rack of ribs for $28. Sauce on the side. Their BBQ saucy is a bit more vinegar-y and sour. But the ribs were fall off the bones tender. Had a pint of Sweet Water by my side. 

Although these ribs were really good, I couldn't help but to think about the ribs I had at Fox Bros. It's not really fair to compare the two since its two very different style, I did prefer Fox Bros BBQ sauce more. But Fat Matt holds his own and you can tell its a local favorite by the line and crowd. I highly recommend both but personally I think Fox Bros had more my style of ribs.

Best pulled pork sandwich around in Atlanta. Ribs are great as well. Cool atmosphere, very down to earth. Staff is friendly. Lines and wait times can get long during peak hours, but ordering ahead typically works well.
This is our BBQ place. It is top in our order in restaurants! Food is always right, hit and delicious!
Entirely over rated and they take themselves too seriously. Service was marginal and no ambiance.

Love Fat Matt's.  Atlanta classic for no-nonsense BBQ.  Casual counter-service style.  Have to get the ribs (of course).  Sides are fine, but the meats are why you go to Fat Matt's.  The dining area is pretty small though. And there's only a few parking spaces - why I give it only 4 stars. This makes going at peak times really challenging - actually pretty much impossible, so go early or late.
We enjoyed the ribs and Mac and cheese. Great Southern BBQ! Line was out the door, but moved quickly. Service was fast and friendly.
I had not been there for years, however, now that I have gone again, I definitely will keep going.  We ordered take out (a full slab) and, for once, the order was perfect!

I've been a Fat Matt's customer and enthusiast since 2010. I can still remember my first order, the BBQ Chicken, with Collard Greens and Mac n Cheese, it was love at first bite. I found myself there at least twice a week. The BBQ, more than authentic, moist, tender and always perfectly cooked, with a sauce that's SO GOOD you want to drink it by the glass. Work took me away from Atlanta for over seven years, but I missed Fat Matt's daily, but now back in the city, I am thrilled to say, Fat Matt's has not lost it's touch, the BBQ is still consistently GREAT! The staff is accommodating, warm and always professional. Whether I order the pulled pork, chicken or ribs, I'm always more than satisfied. The sides are equally mouth-watering , the Mac n Cheese and Collards take me back to my mother's kitchen. From start to finish Fat Matt's is just plain delicious!!!

CASH ONLY!!!

That is a big thing to keep in mind here, but LAWD HAVE MERCY.

This is the best BBQ I ever ate in the south and I lived there for 30 years. Fat Matt's has an amazing price point and even better food.

I always get the ribs and chicken here. When I tell you their bbq will slap the dang taste buds right out of your mouth.....sheesh.

Hands down a must visit if coming to the ATL area. I don't know Fat Matt is, but I love him.

It's been a looong time since I've been here. But, I never went back. Why? Way too over-hyped. Ribs were tough and slathered in BBQ sauce as if to make up for being average at best. Not close to falling off the bone. Plenty of other rib place that are better than this dive.

Clearly the people rating this spot as a  Five Star BBQ are all from NYC or something.  It's good and probably the best one can get in that area, but only 3.9 stars, from my experience.  I went on Memorial Day and the line was 50 people long - leaving me to believe that this was gonna be amazing.  Unfortunately, it was not worth the price or the wait.  I spent $30 for a half slab, two sides, and a drink (pictured).  For some odd reason the lady working the register is also the gatekeeper of the ice....she seemed a bit perturbed when I didn't give her an exact quantity figure as to how much ice I wanted in my cup.  On a good note: the line moved faster than expected and I was able to find a seat outside (I guess most people were taking it to go)

photos.caption: Half Slab of ribs, Cole Slaw, Collard Greens

comment.text: The ribs were almost as awesome as the whole experience of being there. We felt like we got to experience "real Atlanta." My sons said it was the best mac 'n' cheese he's ever had! Highly recommend if you want a cool experience and good food!

photos.caption: Ribs are boiled and sauced! Tender, juicy, and meaty! This is my VERY picky 14 year old diving in!

comment.text:
Unsuspecting bbq joint.  13 tables. Live Blues Band nightly.  Hit this place on the right night and you'll fall in love with a pig and a chicken smothered in tangy slightly spicy saucy heaven.  Add a local brew and you've got yourself a winning combination.  

Ribs are St. Louis type and a bit greasy but that's part of the fun here at Fat Matt's rib shack.  Every time I get to the city of Hot-Lanta, I find my way to the shack.  
Potato salad is house made and great.   Beans have a bourbon finish and are great.  No extra meat in them though.  

The "bird" is grilled on open flame. Smokey hint  and covered in a layer of the good sauce.  Nice.  It was moist and I enjoyed it down to the bone. 

Side of pickles added a little bit of a flavor balance.  Ask for 'em   This place has a vibe so amazing that itS sure to be a favorite for all.  Enjoy some bbq sauce to take home too.  I never leave town without some.  

Sorry about not posting pictures but i was so hungry and my mouth watered upon the table service.  Me likie!
Win win all the way around! We ordered the ribs and pork sandwich with collard greens and coleslaw on the side. Everything was delicious! Can't go wrong here!

They close at 9pm on Tuesday's. No rating due to it being closed 
Yelp hours are incorrect.

Always hot and fresh. Can ho wrong with the ribs falling off the bones! Don't forget the collards and baked beans! The best sweet tea in Atlanta comes from Fat Matt's. They even sell it by the gallon. If you don't believe me, go try it! I dare you!!! It's been my go to barbecue and juke joint since High School. They really need to bring the blues singers back.

Ok so this one is different I've never been here or even Atlanta but I have been to Florida a few times and the bbq food down south is amazing! With a name like fat Matt's rib shack I trust this place with my life. Real quick tho  Fort Lauderdale florida is like New York but hot which means it's awful but At least it's not jersey.

Solid Georgia barbecue joint.

No beef ribs, but the pork ribs are generous and tasty as is the chopped pork sandwich (a local favorite). Prices are very user-friendly. The staff is welcoming and personable. And, the place definitely has a fun, dicey feel that you'll appreciate.

Music night can get a tad loud, but there's outdoor seating, too. 

Don't miss Fat Matt's when you're in ATL.

Great experience! Service was great especially the manager. We are from the Tampa, Fl area and were looking for the best ribs in ATL, WE FOUND THEM !! Chicken was not the best but the ribs and pork were crazyyyy good!

Talk about the road not taken!! We happened upon this place when we took a wrong turn trying to get to a restaurant my friend had recommended. As we were trying to turn around, my husband pulled into this hole in the wall BBQ joint. We both said it looked right up our alley so we headed inside. My husband ordered the rib sandwich with rum beans and I ordered the pork sandwich with sweet potato pie. Incredible!! Luck will lead you to many unexpected places. Live life and try the restaurant!
By the way, we still hit up the other place too!

I've been going here, I think since 1993 or sooner.  The best bbq sauce in the United States, not just Georgia!   The ribs are very good, but at times can be a little fatty.  The service is great.   Get extra sauce with your meal and buy a bottle to take home.  Ask for center cut ribs when you order.  The ribs are far better than the chicken.  The pulled pork sandwiches with extra sauce are great.   Other bbq places offer leaner ribs and pulled pork that's just as good, but there is no place in Georgia, or anywhere in the world that comes even close to the bbq sauce and this is not an exaggeration!

To start, parking is super tight but we found a spot up front. The menu is on the wall and not too many options and that's ok. However everything is sold separately unless you get a chopped pork sandwich because it comes with chips and no substitution. We had chopped pork, 1/2 slab, greens, Mac and cheese, potato salad, chips and lemonade. The was almost $50. The food just wasnt work it. The chopped pork was pulled because when I see chopped I'm expecting chunks. The ribs had a weird texture like they had just been sitting in sauce all day. The mac and potato salad was decent, the lemonade sweet. We didnt finish all of the food. My friend that had the chopped pork just said it tasted weird and looked like school food on the bun. He just really ate his chips. I had been wanting to visit, now I have and I'm good.

This place is good. Being from NC, I am used to a different BBQ pork, but that's not why I come to Fat Matt's, it's the RIBS. The ribs are really good and fall of the bone. Staff have always been great! It's quick and tasty!

I have been coming to this BBQ spot for over 20 years. It never disappoints.  The ribs fall right off the bone, their sauce is well balanced with a little kick.  Collards are delicious and a great compliment.  Menu is simple and they live by the Mantra know what you do and do it well.  A must stop place for me every time I come to Atlanta.  Keep it up!!!!

this food was amazing. food is al la carte, so the sides come in very small containers. the rids finger licking great. they just fell off the bone as soon as you picked them up,  the chicken seasoned to perfection. bbq has a little spice to it but great tasting.  the rum baked beans and mac n cheese a must....... to complete your meal.  the gallon of lemonade was awesome sauce. the staff is very friendly.  fits time visiting and will be back.
Food was awesome and the staff are friendly.  It's a quaint lil spot but there is great food being served.  The live music on weekends is a plus.

Wow! Wow! Wow wow! All the food from here is delicious and tasty and traditional the way I like it and have liked it for a long time. I think 30 or 40 years. I'm 70 and I remember eating at fat maps years ago. That's fat Matt's.

Price point is to high for "ok BBQ"  and bad service not worth the wait. Fox bros. and community BBQ is way better you get more food for the price and service is always great. I recommend those 2 befor I would go to Fatt Matt's

Funny enough, this place was recommended by three different Uber drivers while we were in town, so we knew we had to check it out! 

We split a combo (1/4 chicken, 1/4 slab) and a chopped pork sandwich, and added on a side of rum baked beans and Mac & Cheese.  I wasn't a huge fan of the beans, but everything else was delicious! 

Parking was limited, so I'm glad we Ubered, and there was very limited seating inside. Consider going at a non-peak time, especially if you have more than 4 people in your party. Otherwise, this place is totally worth the trip!

To call this a BBQ joint is a little misleading for die hard BBQ fans. The term "Rib Shack" is much more accurate. The ribs are good, tender, but with enough texture to still have a great bite. But they are devoid of any notes of smoke. I'm not one to douse my ribs in sauce but here I did for 2 reasons. The ribs were a little lighter in flavor than I normally like and the house sauce is delicious!!!! You also won't find brisket here, a bbq joint staple. The sides were tiny and served in small 4oz portion cups. Not meant for sharing. Really liked the collards and mac n cheese. Less fond of the potato salad and cole slaw. Matt's oozes character and has a few characters; both working and dining here. Loved the no frills decor and typical southern hospitality.

Fat Matts is a barbque pace. No frills. Simple and to the point menu. The staff is all very friendly and even wear sauce covered aprons. There is a stage which leads me to believe live music played from time to time. 

The venue: a homage to barbque and blues. Its a small joint and the line is almost always out the door. There are posters and Relics of jazz music and musicians old faded BBQ signs that line the walls. It is a quintessential hole in the wall BBQ joint.

The food: I have the combo that features a quarter slab of ribs and a quarter of chicken both of which are doused in a sweet Tangy in a little spicy sauce. The sides are amazing. I had the greens and Mac & cheese. This is by far the best mac I've ever had. Cheesy, saucy, and amazing.
The food is always good and reasonably priced. Local institution. Basic barbecue joint with a great vibe when there's music going on.
If you're in Atlanta and want to try BBQ, then you need to go here. Great atmosphere and great food. Especially when live music is playing.
Best, fall-off-the-bone ribs around!!! I love it there and glad they survived the Covid era!!
Stopped in while passing through town. Split ribs and chicken - ribs okay but chicken was great! My son and husband loved the Mac n' cheese. Good meal for a good price!!

Sad, i used to drive  over 40 miles to get ribs from this place years ago, went today a total disappointment. 
No flavor to the ribs, just tasteless.  We used to stand in a line out the door especially on a Saturday evening,  today one person in line ahead of us.  That should have been our first clue.  Im not sure if it under new owners but something happened. Total poor quality food, Will not to waste my money here again.
Great Rib shack! Their food is tasty and prices are reasonable. I highly recommend Fat Matt's if you are in the ATL area. Mac N Cheese is very good too.

photos.caption: Menu was so extensive! I love it.

comment.text:
I took my partner here for the 4th of July and we waited in rain for this wonderful meal. She's a foodie and enjoyed the food to the fullest.
Always my BBQ go to joint!!

Another great food and music outing at Fat Macks. We came here to get some Ribs and BBQ sauce, mac and cheese and collard greens, and a glass of that sweet lemonade. Can I tell you that I was not disappointed..The rib sandwich was Hitting..The mac and cheese was on point and the collard greens, lawd ham mercy!! Somebody slap me please. I throughly enjoyed my meal. The live Blues guy was great also..he had a wealth of history regarding the blues to share with the dining public and he sounded pretty damn good. Parking is challenging so be prepared to deal with that.. We spent about 44 dollars to feed three people. All and all I was very satisfied with the meal and I'm looking forward to the next Fat Mack's experience..Also getting out the parking lot is a challenge. My suggestion is to exit through the blimpy parking lot if you can...

No fuss, great bbq spot with outdoor seating!

I was brought here under the pretense that this an ATL staple that is not to be missed. I had some high expectations and, for the most part, Fat Matt's delivered on them.

Between our party, we had a combo (ribs and chicken), pulled pork sandwich, a side of mac and collard greens--yes, I wanted a taste of everything! It was all pretty delicious, fairly priced and decent portions (the sides are a bit smaller than expected, but great, nonetheless). All the BBQ meats had a similar taste which makes sense and can speak to consistency, but the ribs were my favorite.

Enough outdoor tables to sit comfortably during lunch rush--with sanitizing wipes, utensils, hot sauce and napkins aplenty. Everyone seemed to respect social distancing measures so I feel comfortable coming back. If you're looking for a quick $10 lunch to hit the BBQ cravings this is your spot.

Hot take here but I think it's the best BBQ joint in Atlanta. First, the atmosphere is chill and they have live entertainment. Second, the ribs and chicken were amazing. Lastly, the two pieces white bread on the side gave you the feeling you're looking for with the traditional southern feel. Great place and can't wait to go back!

LIVE MUSIC FTW

First eats when we landed in Atlanta was Fat Matt's. Super cool spot for BBQ with patio outdoor seating and indoor tables with live music. 

We got the ribs which were tender, juicy, tangy and very flavorful. It was a bit too sweet so I would probably ask for the sauce on the side. But that's just me (I got diabetes gotta watch my sugar intake). The Mac and cheese and greens were delicious! Didn't care for the white sandwich bread it came with. Loved their sodas and good choices of ice cold beers! 

Staff were attentive and friendly too. Will be coming back!

photos.caption: Enjoying ribs w/ greens and Mac n cheese and a jiving live band!
Ribs super tender. A bit too sweet. Mac and cheese and greens were tasty
Live band was excellent! Really got the ambiance down!
